column1: Sulejówek [sulɛˈjuvɛk] is a town in Poland
column2: about 18 km east of Warsaw city centre and part of its metropolitan area.  It is located in Masovian Voivodeship
column3: in Mińsk County.  Its population numbers 19323 (2011).

column1: The town is well known in Poland as the place where Józef Piłsudski lived in the years between 1923 and 1926.
